channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US senators call for investigation of scam ads on Facebook and Instagram
item.description: Senators cited Reuters reporting that Meta itself estimated its platforms were involved in a third of all scams in the US US senators Josh Hawley and ...

item.title: US reportedly to launch new phase of operations against Venezuela – US politics live
item.description: Trump administration labels Maduro as member of foreign terrorist organization and could impose fresh sanctions on country Trump has also posted posit...

item.title: Diaries, artworks and more to be auctioned from Marianne Faithfull’s personal belongings
item.description: Late singer’s personal effects up for sale including a trunk gifted to her by Carrie Fisher, and artworks by Anita Pallenberg and Marlene Dumas Diarie...

item.title: Trump hints at ‘something good’ after Ukraine peace talks as EU says ‘work remains’ – Europe live
item.description: EU leaders hail progress but emphasise remaining issues to be solved as Merz says peace ‘won’t happen overnight’ US and Ukraine promise ‘updated’ peac...

item.title: Badenoch says growth being held up because ‘the state is too big’ and claims she is getting better at being Tory leader – UK politics live
item.description: Kemi Badenoch tells CBI conference that fewer people are working to support more people out of work Badenoch says the government should be cutting reg...

item.title: Firms and workers reveal impact of Covid response
item.description: Business owners describe breaking into tears as they were forced to lay off staff, while workers feared for their jobs

item.title: Officers facing misconduct hearing in Harshita Brella case
item.description: Four Northamptonshire Police officers will face misconduct proceedings, a police force says.

item.title: What can nervous businesses expect from the Budget?
item.description: It is going to be a nail-biting final few days for business leaders, says the BBC's Business Editor, Simon Jack.

item.title: What is going on with offside, and can it be fixed?
item.description: After more controversy with subjective offside in the Premier League this weekend, can anything be done to change it?

item.title: Jimmy Cliff, reggae singer with a run of hits spanning decades, dies aged 81
item.description: The musician was known for hits like You Can Get It If You Really Want and I Can See Clearly Now.
